required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physica CR and PS Clinical Trial
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentre, Prospective Study Evaluating Clinical, Radiographic and Patient-reported Outcomes of Total Knee Arthroplasty With Physica CR or Physica PS Prosthesis

brief_summary.textblock:
Type & Design:
Post-market, international, multicentre Prospective, parallel groups, open-label, baseline controlled
Objectives:
1. Assessment of clinical, radiographic and patient-reported outcomes of Physica CR and PS designs
2. Incidence of adverse events and identification of possible risk factors for unsatisfactory results
3. Mid-term survivorship of the implants

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical change in Knee Society Score (KSS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: from preoperative (baseline) to 5 years after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical change in Knee Society Score (KSS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: preoperatively (baseline), 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, 2 years, 3 years after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional change in Timed up and Go (TUG) test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: preoperatively (baseline), 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, 2 years, 3 years and 5 years after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Knee injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: preoperatively (baseline), 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, 2 years, 3 years and 5 years after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Satisfaction Visual Analogue Scale (Satisfaction VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months (baseline), 6 months, 1 year, 2 years, 3 years, 4 years and 5 years after surgery
3 months (baseline), 6 months, 1 year, 2 years, 3 years, 4 years and 5 years after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Thickness and location of symptomatic radiolucent lines
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 months (baseline), 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, 2 years, 3 years and 5 years after surgery
0 months, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, 2 years, 3 years, 4 years and 5 years after surgery

study_pop.textblock: General population of subjects requiring a primary TKR with a diagnosis of painful primary or secondary osteoartrithis not responding to other conservative treatments, after the review of medical history and the radiographic evaluation of the affected knee.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male and females
2. Age 22-78 years
3. Any race
4. Ambulatory patients
5. Patients who have a medical condition with over 5 years of life expectancy
6. Patients with painful primary knee osteoarthritis
7. Patients with painful secondary knee osteoarthritis
8. Patients who have undamaged and functional collateral and posterior cruciate ligaments for the group requiring Physica CR
9. Patients who have undamaged and functional collateral ligaments for the group requiring Physica PS
10. Patients with flexion ≥90° on the affected side
11. Patients with a fixed flexion contracture <20°
12. Patients with previous metaphyseal tibial or femoral osteotomy performed more than 5 years before the screening visit, in case of plate removal surgery it is done not early than 1 year
13. Patients who understand the conditions of the study and are willing and able to comply with the prescribed rehabilitation and to perform all scheduled follow-up visits
14. Patients who have signed the Ethics Committee approved study-specific Informed Consent Form prior to the surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with BMI above 35 kg/m2 (severe obesity)
2. Previous partial knee replacement or patellofemoral joint replacement and previous patellectomy
3. Primary Total Knee Replacement (TKR) in the affected knee
4. Varus deformity >20° or Valgus deformity >15°
5. Patients with a fixed flexion contracture >20°
6. Previous intra-articular fractures of the affected knee
7. Previous knee replacement on the contralateral side within the last year and whose outcome is achieving an KSS< 60 points
8. Patients with symptomatic Osteoarthritis (OA) of the spine if the assessment of pain with Numeric Rating Scale is >4
9. Patients with an history of infections (on the affected knee or systemic)
10. Muscular insufficiency or absence of muscoligamentous supporting structures required for adequate soft tissue balance
11. Patients who have damaged or absence of the posterior cruciate ligament for the group requiring Physica CR
12. Patients with known or suspicious metal hypersensitivity
13. Recurrent medical history of severe allergic or immune-mediated reactions
14. Vascular insufficiency of lower limbs severe enough to interfere
15. Current treatment or treatment within the previous 2 years before the screening visit for malignant and life-threatening non-malignant disorders
16. Any clinically significant pathology based on clinical history that the Investigator feels may affect the study evaluation including:
- any intercurrent chronic disease or condition that may interfere with the completion of the 5-year follow-up, such as liver disease, severe coronary disease, drug or alcohol abuse
- significant neurological or musculoskeletal disorders or disease that may adversely affect gait and compromise functional recovery
- neuromuscular or neurosensory deficit which would limit the ability to assess the performance of the device
- known metabolic disorders leading to progressive bone deterioration
17. Patients who have known co-existent medical condition with less 5 years of life expectancy
18. Previous organ transplant surgery
19. Any psychiatric illness that would prevent comprehension of the details and nature of the study
20. Participation in any experimental drug/device study within the 6 months prior to the screening visit
21. Female patients who are pregnant, nursing, or planning a pregnancy -
